meanings.definition: Not dependent on anything else; not contingent.
meanings.sent1: The decision was noncontingent on the weather.
meanings.sent2: Her smile was noncontingent, always bright and cheerful.
meanings.sent3: The cat's noncontingent demand for treats amused the family.
meanings.sent4: His love for her was noncontingent, like a steady flame.
meanings.sent5: The noncontingent stars shone brightly in the night sky.

meanings.definition: Not subject to change or variation; constant.
meanings.sent1: The noncontingent clock ticked steadily on the wall.
meanings.sent2: His loyalty to his friends was noncontingent, unwavering through time.
meanings.sent3: The noncontingent rain poured down without pause, soaking everything.
meanings.sent4: Her noncontingent determination was like a rock in the storm.
meanings.sent5: The noncontingent mountain stood tall against the changing seasons.

meanings.definition: Not determined by or contingent on something else.
meanings.sent1: His success was noncontingent on luck, but on hard work.
meanings.sent2: The truth of the matter was noncontingent on opinions.
meanings.sent3: The noncontingent prize was a surprise to everyone at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her noncontingent decision to travel the world was inspiring.
meanings.sent5: The noncontingent key unlocked the mysterious door.
